label: 蔵人所
本: Capital and Countryside in Japan, 300-1180:  Japanese Historians Interpreted in English . Cornell University East Asia Program . 2006
説明文: the Royal Secretariat was an extracodal office established in the ninth century by Saga Tennô (r. 809-23) to support him in his struggle with his elder brother and predecessor, Heizei Tennô (r. 806-809). Therafter the office took over arranging and provisioning various aspects of royal life in the residential palace, including important liaison duties between the throne and other units of tennô-centered government. [天皇]
